definitions.definition: To cause to grow old; to impart the characteristics of age to.
To postpone an action that would extinguish something, as a debt.
definitions.example: Money's a little tight right now, let's age our bills for a week or so.
One his first assignments was to age the accounts receivable.

definitions.definition: To grow aged; to become old; to show marks of age.
definitions.example: He grew fat as he aged.

definitions.definition: The process of becoming older or more mature.
The deliberate process of making something (such as an antique) appear (or, in science fiction, become) older than it is.

Becoming senescent; accumulating damage to macromolecules, cells, tissues and organs with the passage of time; progressing loss of health, mobility, vibrancy and body functionality, resulting in biological death.

definitions.example: The aging artist could no longer steadily hold the brush.
